did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, manuscripts, professional papers and writings, reviews, publishing correspondence, syllabi, essays, dissertations, notes, meeting agendas, and other papers.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Born Prague, the son of Alexander Kisch, the Chief Rabbi of that city; Author; humanist scholar; Professor of law, Jewish history and bibliography, and Jewry law at the University of Leipzig, the University of Halle, and the Jewish Institute of Religion (New York), later Hebrew-Union College; also Honorary Professor at the University of Basel; founder and editor of Historia Judaica.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, manuscripts, professional papers and writings, reviews, publishing correspondence, syllabi, essays, dissertations, notes, meeting agendas, and other papers of Guido Kisch, relating to German legal history, humanist scholarship, Jewry law, publishing, and to his professional career as author and professor.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: See also: Guido Kisch Collection at the Leo Baeck Institute, Center for Jewish History, New York: http://digifindingaids.cjh.org/?pID=229838

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Guido Kisch Papers, #6314. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
